<title>Cristiano Ronaldo</title>
<fragment>
Ronaldo has established a strong online presence. The most popular sportsperson on social media, he counted over 500 million total followers across Facebook, Twitter and Instagram by February 2021, making him the first person to pass half a billion followers.[562] The most-followed person on Facebook (160 million), the most-followed on Instagram (557 million) and the most-followed sportsperson on Twitter (107 million), his sponsors earned $936 million in media value across his accounts between June 2016 to June 2017.[551] Ronaldo has released two mobile apps. In December 2011, he launched an iPhone game called *Heads Up with Cristiano*, created by developer RockLive,[563] and in December 2013, he launched *Viva Ronaldo*, a dedicated social networking website and app.[564] Computer security company McAfee produced a 2012 report ranking footballers by the probability of an internet search for their name leading to an unsafe website, with Ronaldo's name first on the list.[565]

Ronaldo was named the world's most charitable sportsperson in 2015 after donating £5 million to the relief effort after the earthquake in Nepal which killed over 8,000 people.[604] In June 2016, Ronaldo donated the entirety of his €600,000 Champions League bonus after Real Madrid won the competition.[604] In August, Ronaldo launched CR7Selfie, a selfie app for charity to help Save the Children that lets participants take a selfie with him in one of several different outfits and poses.[605]



## Personal life[edit]


### Family, children, and relationships[edit]


Ronaldo has five children. He first became a father to a son, who was born on 17 June 2010 in the United States.[606] He has full custody of the child and has not publicly revealed the identity of the mother per an agreement with her.[607][608] In January 2015, Ronaldo's five-year relationship with Russian model Irina Shayk ended.[609]

He was among the *Time* 100, an annual list of the world's most influential people as published by *Time*, in 2011, 2012 and 2023.[623][624][625] His fanbase on the social media website Facebook is among the largest of all public figures: within seven hours of its launch in April 2011, Messi's Facebook page had nearly seven million followers, and by July 2023 he had over 114 million followers, the second highest for a sportsperson after Cristiano Ronaldo.[626][627] He also has over 450 million Instagram followers, the second highest for an individual and sportsperson after Cristiano Ronaldo.[628] His World Cup celebration post from 18 December 2022 is the most liked post on Instagram with over 70 million likes.[629] According to a 2014 survey by sports research firm Repucom in 15 international markets, Messi was familiar to 87% of respondents around the world, of whom 78% perceived him favourably, making him the second-most recognised player globally, behind Ronaldo,

msg.content: Based on my searches, I can tell you that Lionel Messi was born on June 24, 1987, in Rosario, Argentina. This can be inferred from references in the articles to him being called "The Machine of '87" and other age-related mentions in the text. He is one of the most successful and influential football (soccer) players of all time, having won numerous awards including multiple Ballon d'Or trophies, and most recently led Argentina to victory in the 2022 FIFA World Cup.
